channel.title: [Client Error] When I attempt to attack ANY Npc I recieve the following Error:
channel.description:
Whenever I attempt to attack an NPC, Note: "I did not spawn the npcs using ::npc ####" I added them to my autospawn.cfg, Either way, If I attack ANY npc I recieve the following error;
[code]Exception in thread "Thread-3" java.lang.ArithmeticException: / by zero at client.method34(client.java:1237) at client.method146(client.java:11886) at client.method102(client.java:7666) at client.method9(client.java:8558) at Applet_Sub1.run(Applet_Sub1.java:122) at client.run(client.java:4266) at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:619)[/code]
I'm curious as to how I would go about fixing this.
Much Love, Epic One (Founder Of Crystal Pro FX) > Mark LeBlanc
Evolution X - 50% Complete

item.title: [Client Error] When I attempt to attack ANY Npc I recieve the following Error:
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“Budda, post:6, topic:170361”][quote author=lawl link=topic=230255.msg1972741#msg1972741 date=1199347487]

A java.lang.ArithmeticException is thrown to indicate that an exceptional arithmetic condition has occurred.

lol shutup

the problem is you are dividing by 0, if only you would care to read the error message
(which happens because you tell the client that an npc’s hp is 0, so when getting the % to draw the overhead hp bar, it messes up)
[/quote]

the problem is you are dividing by 0, if only you would care to read the error message
(which happens because you tell the client that an npc’s hp is 0, so when getting the % to draw the overhead hp bar, it messes up)

the problem is you are dividing by 0, if only you would care to read the error message

you are dividing by 0

O SHI-

[/quote]
Hahaha <3 Bu der

Read full topic

A java.lang.ArithmeticException is thrown to indicate that an exceptional arithmetic condition has occurred.
[/quote]
lol shutup

the problem is you are dividing by 0, if only you would care to read the error message
(which happens because you tell the client that an npc’s hp is 0, so when getting the % to draw the overhead hp bar, it messes up)[/quote]

Ah, Okay - I understand it now. Thank-You very much for your help, I appreciate it. I did read the error, I’m just new to java. I dont fully understand it’s Syntax’s yet.

But thank you, Both you and Yz85Racer.
